meanings.definition: Feeling or showing certainty or assurance
meanings.sent1: She felt confident in her ability to solve the math problem.
meanings.sent2: He always appears confident when speaking in public.
meanings.sent3: The confident squirrel believed it could outsmart the cat.
meanings.sent4: The confident sun rose every morning, sure of its warmth.
meanings.sent5: The confident smile on her face brightened the room.

meanings.definition: Having trust or faith in oneself or others
meanings.sent1: I am confident that my friend will keep our secret.
meanings.sent2: She is confident in her decision to pursue a new career.
meanings.sent3: The confident puppy trusted the toddler not to drop its toy.
meanings.sent4: The confident oak tree stood tall, believing in its roots.
meanings.sent5: His confident belief in the goodness of people never wavered.

meanings.definition: Bold or self-assured in behavior or mannerism
meanings.sent1: The confident lion roared loudly to assert its dominance.
meanings.sent2: She walked into the room with a confident stride.
meanings.sent3: The confident dancer twirled gracefully on the stage.
meanings.sent4: The confident river flowed steadily through the valley.
meanings.sent5: His confident attitude made him a natural leader.
